page.title: 10HEALTH PROVISION IN BARR
page.content: The village of Barr is too small to have it's own resident doctor.Most of the people in the area go to Dr.Robertson who lives and has his main surgery in the village of Dailly. On certain days of the week the doctor uses the village hall as a surgery.The doctor also dispenses medicines,which is handy as there is not a chemist in the village. There is a health visitor who usually visits new-born babies and old-folk. The mobile dentist's caravan visits the school twice a year to check the school children's teeth.Four times a year the chiropodist's caravan comes to the school playground-this time for the adults. The nearest hospital is at Girvan. There are limited facilities,in Girvan for the mentally and physically handicapped.
